Package com.penthera.virtuososdk.client

Interface IBackplaneSettings

  • public interface IBackplaneSettings
    Provides access to the current Backplane configuration and the Backplane Controlled Settings.
    CategoryTitle:
    005_backplane Backplane Settings Methods

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      String getDeviceId()
      The identifier for this device, according to the Backplane.
      String getDeviceNickname()
      The current nickname for this device, according to the Backplane.
      String getDevicePushToken()
      GooglePlay services registration ID.
      boolean getDownloadEnabled()
      Determine whether this device is download-enabled, according to the Backplane.
      long getExpiryAfterDownload()
      Default "Expiry After Download" (EAD) value, according to the Backplane
      EAD is the amount of time, in seconds, for which an asset is available after Virtuoso has completed downloading it.
      long getExpiryAfterPlay()
      Default "Expiry After Download" (EAD) value, according to the Backplane
      EAD is the amount of time, in seconds, for which an asset is available after Virtuoso has completed downloading it.
      String getExternalDeviceId()
      The current external device id for this device, according to the Backplane.
      long getMaxCopiesPerAsset()
      Max permitted copies per Asset.
      long getMaxDevicesAllowedForDownload()
      "Max Devices for Download" (MDD) value, according to the Backplane
      MDD is the number of devices a user can have enabled for download at one time.
      long getMaxDownloadsPerAccount()
      Max permitted downloads per account.
      long getMaxDownloadsPerAsset()
      Max permitted downloads per Asset.
      long getMaxOffline()
      "Max Offline" (MOFF) value, according to the Backplane
      If Virtuoso has not been able to communicate with the Backplane for more than MOFF amount of time, Virtuoso will deny API access to all downloaded assets
      long getMaxPermittedDownloads()
      Max permitted downloads (MPD).
      boolean getRequirePermissionWhenQueued()
      Get the current value for requiring permission checks when queueing an Asset.
      URL getURL()
      Current Backplane URL.
      int getUsedDownloadQuota()
      Number of download enabled-devices the user currently has registered with the Backplane
      This value specifies the number of devices a user has currently enabled for download.
      String getUserId()
      Identifier of the current user registered with the Backplane

    • Method Detail

      • getURL

        URL getURL()
        Current Backplane URL. You should have set this URL via a previous call to startup.
        Returns:
        The current Backplane URL; null if not set
        Category:
        005_backplane

      • getUserId

        String getUserId()
        Identifier of the current user registered with the Backplane
        Returns:
        Identifier of the current user registered with the Backplane or null
        Category:
        005_backplane

      • getExternalDeviceId

        String getExternalDeviceId()
        The current external device id for this device, according to the Backplane.
        Returns:
        External device identifier registered with the Backplane or null
        Category:
        005_backplane

      • getDeviceNickname

        String getDeviceNickname()
        The current nickname for this device, according to the Backplane. The Backplane uses the device ID as the default nickname, but if you change it via changeNickname, Virtuoso will persist the change to the Backplane.
        Returns:
        Nickname of this device, or null if Virtuoso has not yet sync'ed with the Backplane
        Category:
        005_backplane

      • getDevicePushToken

        String getDevicePushToken()
        GooglePlay services registration ID. You may use this method to ensure that push subscriptions have been set up successfully.
        Returns:
        GooglePlay services registration ID

      • getDownloadEnabled

        boolean getDownloadEnabled()
        Determine whether this device is download-enabled, according to the Backplane.
        Returns:
        True if enabled, false if unknown or Virtuoso has not yet synced with Backplane.
        Category:
        005_backplane

      • getDeviceId

        String getDeviceId()
        The identifier for this device, according to the Backplane. This Identifier is generated by the SDK.
        Returns:
        The identifier registered with the Backplane
        Category:
        005_backplane

      • getMaxDevicesAllowedForDownload

        long getMaxDevicesAllowedForDownload()
        "Max Devices for Download" (MDD) value, according to the Backplane
        MDD is the number of devices a user can have enabled for download at one time.
        Returns:
        The MDD value, or -1 if Virtuoso has not yet retrieved the value from the Backplane
        Category:
        005_backplane

      • getMaxOffline

        long getMaxOffline()
        "Max Offline" (MOFF) value, according to the Backplane
        If Virtuoso has not been able to communicate with the Backplane for more than MOFF amount of time, Virtuoso will deny API access to all downloaded assets
        Returns:
        Max Offline value, or -1 if Virtuoso has not yet retrieved the value from the Backplane
        Category:
        005_backplane

      • getExpiryAfterDownload

        long getExpiryAfterDownload()
        Default "Expiry After Download" (EAD) value, according to the Backplane
        EAD is the amount of time, in seconds, for which an asset is available after Virtuoso has completed downloading it. After this time, Virtuoso will expire the Asset, meaning that Virtuoso will delete the asset as soon as possible.
        Returns:
        The EAD value, or Long.MAX_VALUE if Virtuoso has not yet retrieved the value from the Backplane
        Category:
        005_backplane

      • getExpiryAfterPlay

        long getExpiryAfterPlay()
        Default "Expiry After Download" (EAD) value, according to the Backplane
        EAD is the amount of time, in seconds, for which an asset is available after Virtuoso has completed downloading it. After this time, Virtuoso will expire the Asset, meaning that Virtuoso will delete the asset as soon as possible.
        Returns:
        The EAD value, or Long.MAX_VALUE if Virtuoso has not yet retrieved the value from the Backplane
        Category:
        005_backplane

      • getUsedDownloadQuota

        int getUsedDownloadQuota()
        Number of download enabled-devices the user currently has registered with the Backplane
        This value specifies the number of devices a user has currently enabled for download.
        Returns:
        Number of download-enabled devices belonging to this user, or -1 if Virtuoso has not yet synced with the Backplane
        Category:
        005_backplane

      • getMaxPermittedDownloads

        long getMaxPermittedDownloads()
        Max permitted downloads (MPD). The maximum number of downloaded assets that can be on the device at a time.
        Virtuoso limits the total number of downloads the device can have on disk at any given time. Any download requests beyond this limit are queued, but will not download, and the engine will report an error indicating the download queue is blocked until the user manually deletes enough of the currently downloaded assets to get below the limit again. The default value is 100.
        Returns:
        Maximum number of assets that can be on the device at any moment.
        Category:
        005_backplane

      • getMaxDownloadsPerAccount

        long getMaxDownloadsPerAccount()
        Max permitted downloads per account. The maximum number of downloaded assets that can be on all end users devices at a time.
        Virtuoso limits the total number of downloads the user can have on disk across all their devices at any given time. Any download requests beyond this limit are queued, but will not download, and the engine will report an error indicating the download queue is blocked until the user manually deletes enough of the currently downloaded assets, on this device or other devices, to get below the limit again. The default value is -1 (unlimited).
        Returns:
        Maximum number of downloads that can exist across users devices, -1 if unlimited.
        Category:
        005_backplane

      • getMaxDownloadsPerAsset

        long getMaxDownloadsPerAsset()
        Max permitted downloads per Asset. The maximum number of times an asset can be downloaded across the users devices.
        Once the user has downloaded the asset this many times, no more copies can be downloaded on any of the user's devices. This value is provided by the Backplane.
        Returns:
        Maximum number of times an asset can be downloaded, -1 if unlimited.
        Category:
        005_backplane

      • getMaxCopiesPerAsset

        long getMaxCopiesPerAsset()
        Max permitted copies per Asset. The maximum number of copies of an asset that can be downloaded at any one time across the user's devices.
        Once the user has downloaded the asset this many times, no more copies can be downloaded on any of the user's devices until a copy has been deleted from another device. This value is provided by the Backplane.
        Returns:
        Maximum number of copies of an asset that can be downloaded, -1 if unlimited
        Category:
        005_backplane

      • getRequirePermissionWhenQueued

        boolean getRequirePermissionWhenQueued()
        Get the current value for requiring permission checks when queueing an Asset. Normally, the download engine acquires any necessary download permissions when the item starts downloading. By delaying the permission check until download can occur, the SDK can allow new assets to be queued while the device is offline. If this setting is enabled, the download engine acquires permissions when the item is initially queued. This means that assets can only be created and queued when the device is online. If this setting is enabled and permissions are required (Max Downloads per Account or Max Downloads per Asset are configured), then attempts to create or queue an asset whilst offline will fail.
        Returns:
        True if permission checks are required when queued. False if permissions are checked at start of download.
        Category:
        005_backplane
